moves.1. e4:
This is a game I should have lost. I blundered and lost the queen, and against such as strong player this should have been fatal.
Chess shock normally kicks in, and the game is flawed from such a point forward. I had hoped to get a draw, and was surprised to win
moves.1... g6 2. Nf3 Bg7 3. d4 b6 4. Nc3 Bb7 5: The attack by the pawns proved to be powerful later in the game
moves.10... Ne8 11. d5 a6 12. h4 b5 13. h5 b4: First blunder. I should have seen the attack on b2
moves.14. Ne2 Bxb2 15. Rb1 Ne5 16. Nxe5: What choice is there. If I let it be, I would have a fork on the king and queen on 3, I would loose my queen.
moves.16... Bxe5 17. f4 Bg7 18. f5 Nc7 19. Nf4: What was I thinking? Serious blunder
moves.19... Bc3: At this stage the game was probably over.
moves.20. Qxc3: Might as well get the bishop in exchange for the queen. Not a nice feeling.
moves.20... bxc3 21. Rxb7: Also captured the bishop, but still seriously down on pieces.
moves.21... Rb8 22. hxg6: Got another pawn, and the pawn at g6 can do some damage if ignored. Perhaps not, but it looks dangerous
moves.22... hxg6 23. Rxb8: I think he should have taken the rook.
moves.23... Qxb8 24. Ke2: Don't want the king pined in front of a defenseless rook
moves.24... Qb2 25. fxg6 fxg6 26. Nxg6: Ok, the opponents king is open. I have a rook on h, and a bishop on white.
moves.26... Rf7 27. Rh8+ Kg7 28. Rh6 Qb1: Now I have to watch f1. Block the line for the rook
moves.29. Nf4 Qxa2 30. Nh5+: I can move the knite back again, now that the queen has moved.
moves.31... Rf8 32. g7 Re8 33. e5 Qxd5:
Now I need to be careful. That queen has a lot of places to move to and can do some serious damage.
But since I have the initiative, I might as well work with it.
moves.34. Bh7+ Kf7 35. Bg6+: The rook is pinned, but swapping the rook for my bishop would not be good. I still have a deficit of pieces and the queen is protecting g8.
moves.35... Ke6: This is forced. Forking the king and  queen will help my desperate situation.
moves.36. Nf4+:
I consider myself very fortunate. The opponent is very strong and has a material advantage.
But I had the initiative, the more mobile pieces and perhaps a better position.
